title: Genetics and plant breeding
creator_credit: David Morphet, Peter Bradford, Unilever Films and World Wide Pictures
brief_description: Mendel’s laws of inheritance, and how the passage of the dominant and recessive characteristics from one generation to another depends on discrete particles of matter, particles which are now known to be genes on the chromosomes in the cell nucleus. It shows how the principles of genetics are applied to produce new varieties of plants.
